com.rdio.android.api
Class Rdio

java.lang.Object
  com.rdio.android.api.Rdio

public class Rdio
extends java.lang.Object

Main facade object for interacting with Rdio. Provides methods to stream content and make API requests. See http://developer.rdio.com for details, and https://github.com/rdio/hello-android for sample code.

Field Detail

LIBRARY_VERSION

public static final int LIBRARY_VERSION
Version for this library, incremented whenever significant changes are made.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESULT_AUTHORISATION_ACCEPTED

public static final int RESULT_AUTHORISATION_ACCEPTED
Success result code passed to onActivityResult after you launch the intent from onRdioUserAppApprovalNeeded(). Indicates that the onActivityResult data parameter can be used with Rdio.setTokenAndSecret()

RESULT_AUTHORISATION_REJECTED

public static final int RESULT_AUTHORISATION_REJECTED
Failure result code passed to onActivityResult after you launch the intent from onRdioUserAppApprovalNeeded(). Indicates that the user has not granted authorisation.

Constructor Detail

Rdio

public Rdio(java.lang.String appKey,
            java.lang.String appSecret,
            java.lang.String accessToken,
            java.lang.String accessSecret,
            android.content.Context context,
            RdioListener listener)
Constructor for the Rdio facade. Requires a developer key and secret, available from developer.rdio.com

Parameters:
appKey - Your application OAuth key
appSecret - Your application OAuth secret
accessToken - A user access token, allowing API calls on behalf of a user, obtained from a RdioListener.onRdioAuthorised() in a previous session. May be null.
accessSecret - A user access secret, provided along with the user access token in RdioListener.onRdioAuthorised(). May be null.
context - You application context (or Activity context)
listener - A callback interface, called from the main UI thread. Used to find out when the API is ready for use.
Method Detail

cleanup

public void cleanup()
Unhooks listeners and releases any resources. Should be called before destroying the Rdio object.

isReady

public boolean isReady()
Is the Rdio API ready for playback and has it established the user subscription state?

Returns:
true if the Rdio API is ready, false if it is not.

signRequest

public void signRequest(java.lang.Object request)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
OAuth signs a request for the Rdio API using your application key and secret. 
 Example:
                HttpClient client = new DefaultHttpClient();
                HttpPost post = new HttpPost("http://api.rdio.com/1/");
                params.add(new BasicNameValuePair("method", "get"));
                params.add(new BasicNameValuePair("keys", "a123"));
                post.setEntity(new UrlEncodedFormEntity(params));
                rdio.signRequest(post)
                HttpResponse response = client.execute(post);

Parameters:
request - An HttpRequest, HttpURLConnection etc.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If the key/secret is invalid or the request can't be handled

getPlayerForTrack

public android.media.MediaPlayer getPlayerForTrack(java.lang.String trackKey,
                                                   java.lang.String sourceKey,
                                                   boolean isManualPlay)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Constructs a MediaPlayer for the given track key. The player will be initialized with a datasource for the full track or a 30 second sample depending on the user's subscription state.

NOTE: This method may block and should not be called from the UI thread.

Parameters:
trackKey - Track identifier, like "t5123". See "key" field on track objects.
sourceKey - Source identifier, e.g. an album like "a5123", to which the track belongs. May be null.
isManualPlay - Pass true if playback is starting due to a user action, false if automatically advancing between songs. Used to determine when the user is also playing elsewhere. See RdioListener.
Returns:
MediaPlayer with a datasource already set.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Thrown if the track cannot be played for any reason

canUserPlayFullStreams

public boolean canUserPlayFullStreams()
Can the user play full streams? Only valid after onRdioReady() is called on the listener or isReady() returns true

Returns:
true if the user can play full streams, false if they can not.

getSubscriptionState

public RdioSubscriptionType getSubscriptionState()
Returns the subscription state for the user signed in to the Rdio application. Only valid after onRdioReady() is called on the listener, as an IPC call to the Rdio app is required.

Returns:
the subscription state

setTokenAndSecret

public void setTokenAndSecret(android.content.Intent data)
Set an access token used to make API calls on behalf of the current Rdio user.

Parameters:
data - Data passed to onActivityResult after firing the intent passed to onRdioUserAppApprovalNeeded() in your RdioListener.

signUp

public void signUp(java.lang.String email,
                   java.lang.String affiliateUrl)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   RdioSignupException
Begin the Rdio account signup process using a LinkShare affiliate URL. This is a synchronous call so it shouldn't be called on the main UI thread.

Parameters:
email - The user's email address. A confirmation email will be sent to this address including a link that the user can click to complete the process.
affiliateUrl - A LinkShare affiliate "Deep Link" URL for Rdio that will look something like: http://click.linksynergy.com/fs-bin/click?id=VVV=&offerid=WWW&type=XXX&tmpid=YYY&RD_PARM1=ZZZ
Throws:
java.io.IOException - An error occurred contacting the LinkShare or Rdio servers
RdioSignupException - An error occurred processing the API request

signUp

public void signUp(java.lang.String email)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   RdioSignupException
Throws:
java.io.IOException
RdioSignupException

apiCall

public void apiCall(java.lang.String method,
                    java.util.List<org.apache.http.NameValuePair> params,
                    RdioApiCallback callback)
Call an Rdio web service API method, using the credentials of the current user. The request is executed asynchronously on a background thread, and the callback is returned on the UI thread.

Parameters:
method - See http://developer.rdio.com/docs/read/REST for a list of available methods
params - A list of name/value pairs as required by the given method
callback - A callback used to get the result of the call
